intro: Humboltia fritillaria, commonly known as the golden cup, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are grass-like and form a basal rosette, while its flowers are borne on a tall, leafless stem. Humboltia fritillaria is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
